data.content:
noun
[noncount] a function that causes a recording (such as a videotape) to go forward at a speed that is faster than normal
Hit the fast-forward button. - opposite 2rewind
a state in which something is quickly developing or progressing
Taking those classes put her career in fast-forward.
verb
-wards; -warded; -warding
[+ obj] :to cause (a recording) to go forward at a speed that is faster than normal
We fast-forwarded the tape to get to the last song. - opposite 1rewind
[no obj] :to move forward through time quickly
He wished he could fast-forward to the future, when he would no longer be a student.
